I know what Blue Origin is doing is incredible, and that there's a staggering amount of engineering and creativity going into the programs, but dang, it's not very exciting.
Their R&D philosophy is definitely much different than SpaceX, and their initial revenue generating model is TOTALLY out of reach for anyone but the richest of the rich in the world and will have absolutely zero application for anyone else.
While there's a lot of people that dislike Elon Musk (which, I understand), at least he's laser focused on extremely long term goals and is doing everything to achieve them, and the tech him and his teams are developing and deploying will have a tangible impact on a lot of normal people around the world.
That said, New Glenn will be a sight to behold.... someday...

Watching its pre-launch gimbal test, Blue Origin's engines don't seem to move as fluidly as Starship's. It looks to me like their final position is specified and the engines gimbal to that position at a constant speed. This might be a factor in apparent overcorrection "teetering" as the booster comes in to land. Starship seems to have a tighter feedback loop for the touchdown dance.
